snippet: A California judge has ruled against the Defense Department's ''don't ask, don't tell'' policy for homosexuals in the military and ordered the California National Guard to open its ranks to openly gay members.     The judge, David Garcia of San Fr...
lead_paragraph: A California judge has ruled against the Defense Department's ''don't ask, don't tell'' policy for homosexuals in the military and ordered the California National Guard to open its ranks to openly gay members. The judge, David Garcia of San Francisco Superior Court, said late Monday that California's National Guard was violating the state constitutional rights of gay men, lesbians and bisexuals by banning them from service under the Federal ''don't ask, don't tell'' policy.
abstract: San Francisco Superior Court Judge David Garcia rules against Defense Dept's 'don't ask, don't tell' policy for homosexuals in military and orders California National Guard to open its ranks to openly gay members (S)

headline.main: National Guard Told to Admit Gay Troops
